basics.name: Yeonwoo Jeong
basics.summary: With an academic background of psychology, medicine, and neuroscience across S. Korea and the U.S., I aspire to become a warm-hearted neuropsychiatrist and biopsychiatry researcher. My long-term research goal is to further refine our conceptualization of mental illness, intertwining pioneering discoveries in psychoneuroimmunology with a profound understanding of the human mind achievable through clinical expertise.

courses: Foundational sciences (MS1): anatomy, histology, physiology, biochemistry, neuroscience, immunology, pathology, microbiology, pharmacology, genetics, developmental biology, epidemiology
Clinical sciences (MS2): integrated organ-based courses on major medical fields (e.g., internal medicine, neurology, psychiatry)
Longitudinal introductory courses on history of medicine, medical ethics, public & global health, palliative care, forensic medicine, etc.
Elective courses: neuropsychiatry research methods, clinical neuroanatomy, spatial transcriptomics, clinical genomics
Thesis: Empowering memories help maintain self-confidence in a stressful task
Relevant coursework: experimental psychology, personality, abnormal psychology, counseling, development, biopsychology, brain-mind-behavior seminar, data science in human neuroimaging
Yeongjae Merit Scholarship (partial tuition) from Fall 2018

work.name: Department of Psychiatry, Weill Cornell Medical College (PI: Conor Liston)
work.position: Research Collaborator, Systems Neuroscience & Biological Psychiatry Lab.
highlights: Precision functional mapping of the salience network in major depressive disorder

work.name: Department of Psychology, Scripps College (PI: Heejung Park)
work.position: Research Collaborator, Cultural & Developmental Psychology Lab.
highlights: Positive youth development in adolescents from diverse backgrounds
Meaning-making and resilience in traumatized communities

work.name: Department of Biomedical Sciences, Seoul National University (PI: Seung-Jae Lee)
work.position: Student Research Assistant, Lab. of Neurological Disease
highlights: Changes in alpha-synuclein-exposed oligodendrocytes in Parkinson's disease
Neuron-to-oligodendrocyte alpha-synuclein transmission via TLR2 in multiple system atrophy
TLR2 & innate immunity in alpha-synucleinopathies

publications.name: Toll-like receptor 2 mediates oligodendrogliopathy in alpha-synucleinopathies
publications.summary: Oral session presented at 39th Convention of the Seoul National University College of Medicine Alumni Association of North America, Falls Church, VA.

publications.name: Neuron-to-oligodendrocyte alpha-synuclein transmission in multiple system atrophy is mediated by Toll-like receptor 2
publications.summary: Poster session presented at 1st Seoul National University Physician-Scientist Training Program Workshop, Incheon, South Korea.

publications.name: Expression of neural phenotype in alpha-synuclein-exposed human oligodendrocytes
publications.summary: Oral session presented at 2022 Seoul National University Premedical Course Research Festival, Seoul, South Korea.

projects.name: Profiling Vaccine-Related Immunological Adverse Reactions in Pharmacovigilance Reports
projects.summary: Employing the Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS), a U.S. vaccine safety program managed by the CDC and the FDA, our team is compiling and analyzing case reports of a particular type of immunological adverse reaction following vaccination. This research project aims to raise clinical awareness about this devastating yet often overlooked condition, also suggesting implications for etiological research.
highlights: Advisor: Sun-Young Yum, Brain Boutique, Inc.

projects.name: Understanding the Lived Experiences of Multicultural Youth in South Korea
projects.summary: This is a collaborative interdisciplinary fieldwork-and-volunteering project, conducting a longitudinal investigation of the developmental trajectories and well-being of adolescents from diverse backgrounds in South Korea. These youth, including the children of immigrant families and adolescents from North Korean backgrounds, may experience difficulties growing up in the traditionally monoethnic South Korean society and culture. Volunteering in the research sites to ensure that we can provide our participants with what they truly want and need, we plan on incorporating research techniques spanning quantitative and qualitative domains to gather a holistic perspective of everyday life in these youth.
highlights: Advisors: Heejung Park, Scripps College Psychology; Jessica Chiang, Georgetown Psychology

awards.title: Travel Award for the 39th Convention of the SNUCMAA of North America
awards.awarder: Seoul National University College of Medicine Alumni Association of North America
awards.summary: Awarded to 8 abstracts among those accepted for oral presentation at the 39th Convention of the Seoul National University College of Medicine Alumni Association of North America ($1,500).

awards.title: Health Fellowship Foundation Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to selected 4 undergraduate & 11 graduate student research proposals from nationwide applicants in the medical field ($5,000 fellowship).

awards.title: Hakgye Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to distinctive candidates among 150 nationwide applicants, based on academic achievement and potential (full tuition until graduation).

awards.title: Premedical Course Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to 10 students with highest total GPA at completion of the premedical program. (GPA: 3.91/4.00)

awards.title: Premedical Student Research Award
awards.summary: Awarded to 2 among 45 research participants in the premedical course, after oral presentation of selected abstracts ($1,000 scholarship). My presentation was displayed as an exemplary research output in the premedical course student orientation resources for 2023.

awards.title: Volunteer Social Service Award
awards.summary: Awarded to 5 among 142 participants in Volunteer Social Service, an elective volunteering program in Seoul National University.

awards.title: Talent Award of Korea
awards.awarder: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Education of the Republic of Korea
awards.summary: The national honor awarded to 50 South Korean high school students with outstanding academic, leadership, and volunteer achievements regarding creativity, devotion, innovation, altruism, and community contribution ($2,000 scholarship).

awards.title: Korean Chemistry Olympiad Finalist: Certificate of Merit in Chemistry Winter School
awards.summary: Awarded to distinctive candidates among 27 finalists in Korean Chemistry Olympiad (KChO).

awards.title: Korean Biology Olympiad Finalist: Future Biologist Award
awards.awarder: The Korean Society of Biology Education
awards.summary: Awarded to 32 finalists in Korean Biology Olympiad (KBO).

volunteer.summary: English Learner Program for Youth from Diverse Backgrounds
highlights: Designing and conducting a 4-week in-person English Learner Program for youth from diverse backgrounds in South Korea.
Collaborating with students from the Claremont Colleges to brainstorm hands-on activities best suited for an exciting language immersion experience.
Relevant research project: Understanding the Lived Experiences of Multicultural Youth in South Korea, 2024–Present.

volunteer.summary: Mentoring Middle & High School Students to Envision Career and Life
highlights: Advised and supported 48 middle & high school students, mainly focusing on career pathways, recommended skillsets in achieving life goals, upkeeping mental health, etc.

In-depth virtual & on-site sessions (approx. 2–3 hrs per session) to delve into mentees' true dreams and desires, actively discussing various aspects of their everyday life to understand them as a whole person.
Emotional support for students intimidated by the hyper-competitive Korean college application process, working together to find out their unique colors and promote well-being.

volunteer.summary: Cafeteria Server for the Equitable College Community, with Tenspoon
highlights: Worked weekly as a server in the college canteen, associated with Tenspoon (십시일밥 in Korean), a non-profit organization which provides meal vouchers to students from low-income families with wages earned by volunteer cafeteria workers.
Packaging COVID-19 self-test (rapid antigen test) kits to be distributed to visitors (20 hrs total).

volunteer.summary: Leading a Psychology & Psychiatry Book Club for Teenagers
highlights: Hosted a book club for 3 teenage students, meeting for 4 sessions on Psychiatry for Teens (청소년을 위한 정신의학 에세이 in Korean) by Jee Hyun Ha (Korean essay).
Discussed psychoanalysis, the brain & mind, diagnosis of mental disorders, psychology experiments (each mentee shared their most intriguing ones), patient-centered care & healing, etc.
Holistic view of psychiatric diagnosis & therapy with various multimedia tools, e.g. Homeless by Anna Quindlen (essay), How 'Mad' Are You? (2018 SBS Australia documentary).

volunteer.summary: Learning Mentor for a Middle School Student, with Peachmarket
highlights: Prepared & led weekly critical reading sessions for a slow learner student in middle school, under the guidance of Peachmarket (피치마켓 in Korean), an organization advocating for personalized study materials aligning with diverse backgrounds and environments.

Gathering excerpts from news articles, Korean novels, etc. in line with the student's preferences and needs, openly discussing relevant questions about the reading material to enhance overall literacy and understanding of the weekly topic.

volunteer.summary: Phase 2 (Let Theatre Grow) of Theatre Together
highlights: Contributed to creating and staging On My Way, a novel English musical performance based on real life stories of students from North Korean backgrounds.
Collaborated with fellow THE SCENE (musical theatre club) members and St. Paul Preparatory Seoul students, working with an alternative school for NK defector & multicultural youth.
Advisory roles in intensive workshops (63 hrs total) including character & plot development, music arrangement, and directing.

volunteer.summary: Phase 1 (Let Theatre Bloom) of Theatre Together
highlights: Spreading the value of sharing through the Theatre Together project with fellow THE SCENE (musical theatre club) members.
Hosted & took part in regular cultural events for the locals in Hoengseong, e.g. the elderly in nursing homes, recreation forest festival, local food festival, provincial youth musical gala, etc.
Rearranged Les Misérables to be more in terms with Korean culture, translated & provided 1600 lines of Korean subtitles for the full performance.

volunteer.summary: English-to-Korean Translator for Khan Acdaemy Videos
highlights: Worked 166 hrs total as a volunteer English-to-Korean translator, wrote subtitles for Khan Academy educational videos (biology, chemistry, medicine, mathematics, etc.).
Nominated as excellent & diligent volunteer.
